alert.note: Alert for Brown (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 13 at 10:06PM CDT until May 20 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Minnesota and south central Minnesota, including the following counties, in central Minnesota, Sibley. In south central Minnesota, Blue Earth, Brown, Le Sueur, Nicollet and Watonwan. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM CDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Some roads are closed due to flooding. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1004 PM CDT, local law enforcement reported flooded roads in Brown County. Flooding is already occurring. Between 2 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. Continued rain overnight could lead to flooding farther east toward Nicollet and Le Sueur counties. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mankato, New Ulm, North Mankato, St. Peter, Lake Crystal, Le Center, Springfield, Winthrop, Nicollet, Kasota, Courtland, Butterfield, Lafayette, Hanska, Comfrey, Cleveland, Judson, Oshawa, New Sweden and Ottawa.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
